docs.lead_paragraph: ROCHESTER, July 30 - Rudolph W. Giuliani today proposed transforming the way health care is provided in America, advocating a move from the current employer-based system to one that grants substantial tax benefits to people who purchased their own insurance.

headline.main: Giuliani Calls for Tax Breaks to Buy Health Insurance

docs.abstract: Rudolph W. Giuliani is advocating a move from the current employer-based system to one that grants substantial tax benefits to people who purchase their own insurance.
docs.snippet: Rudolph W. Giuliani is advocating a move from the current employer-based system to one that grants substantial tax benefits to people who purchase their own insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: With several of the other Democratic presidential candidates posting far stronger poll and fund-raising numbers, Joe Biden, the veteran Delaware senator, has to work a little harder to even get noticed in the crowded primary field. This week he'll ramp up with a book tour celebrating the publication of his new autobiography, "Promises to Keep: On Life and Politics" and a spate of related media appearances.
docs.abstract: Senator Joe Biden pushes his presidential bid with a television-packed book tour this week.
docs.snippet: Senator Joe Biden pushes his presidential bid with a television-packed book tour this week.

docs.lead_paragraph: LOUISVILLE, Ky., July 30 (AP) — The health insurer Humana Inc. reported Monday that its second-quarter profit more than doubled from a year ago on the strength of improved cost controls and sharply higher income from its government business.
docs.snippet: LOUISVILLE, Ky., July 30 (AP) — The health insurer Humana Inc. reported Monday that its second-quarter profit more than doubled from a year ago on the strength of improved cost controls and sharply higher income from its government business.

docs.lead_paragraph: The nation’s largest insurer of home loans said its stake in a business that underwrites and invests in mortgage securities may be worthless.

headline.main: More Lenders Feeling Pain From Defaults
headline.print_headline: More Lenders Feeling Pain From Defaults

docs.snippet: The nation’s largest insurer of home loans said its stake in a business that underwrites and invests in mortgage securities may be worthless.

byline.contributor: Carter Dougherty contributed reporting from Frankfurt.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''G.O.P. Leaders Fight Expansion of Children's Health Insurance'' (news article, July 25):
docs.abstract: Prof Stephen M Davidson letter says expanding Children's Health Insurance Program is 'no-brainer' (July 25 article)
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     Re ''G.O.P. Leaders Fight Expansion of Children's Health Insurance'' (news article, July 25):

docs.lead_paragraph: LACONIA, N.H. -- In preparation for Rudolph W. Giuliani's speech about health care here in New Hampshire tomorrow, his campaign announced the team of advisers today and made them available to reporters to explain Mr. Giuliani's vision.
docs.abstract: The former New York mayor turns to details of a new initiative in New Hampshire tomorrow.
docs.snippet: The former New York mayor turns to details of a new initiative in New Hampshire tomorrow.

docs.lead_paragraph: Paul Krugman responds to readers' comments on his July 30 column, "An Immoral Philosophy."

headline.main: Robbing The Children to Pay the Insurance Companies

docs.abstract: Paul Krugman responds to readers' comments on his July 30 column, "An Immoral Philosophy." Elaine Zablocki, Eugene, Ore.: I'm dismayed to read your current column about the legislation to fund Schip by cutting Medicare Advantage. I am enrolled in a Medicare Advantage plan. Of course I want uninsured children to have health insurance. On the [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: Congress’s Republican minority leaders are picking the wrong fight in suddenly attacking a notably bipartisan push to expand health insurance coverage to hundreds of thousands of children of the working poor.
docs.snippet: Congress’s Republican minority leaders are picking the wrong fight in suddenly attacking a notably bipartisan push to expand health insurance coverage to hundreds of thousands of children of the working poor.

docs.lead_paragraph: What kind of philosophy says that it’s O.K. to subsidize insurance companies, but not to provide health care to children?
docs.snippet: What kind of philosophy says that it’s O.K. to subsidize insurance companies, but not to provide health care to children?
